poem:
**Reporters' Refrain**

Ink and lenses, truth encased,  
beneath a canvas sky, displaced.  
Through Gaza's sound—a silent scream,  
their stories fade, as voices stream.  

Unwritten bylines, names erased,  
courage in shadows, lives effaced.  
Journalists, in darkness shroud,  
bear witness where the world is loud.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Western journalists are failing to stand up for their colleagues in Gaza | Mohamad Bazzi For nearly two years, Israel has been systemically targeting and killing Palestinian journalists in Gaza. On Sunday night, the Israeli military brazenly killed another six journalists, who had been sheltering in a tent housing media workers in Gaza City. Among them was the 28-year-old Al Jazeera correspondent Anas al-Sharif and the rest of the network’s team reporting from the besieged". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
